intro: Epilobium canadense, commonly known as Canadian willowherb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. Epilobium canadense is often found in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and disturbed sites.
